abstract_summ: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), the virus causing causing Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) was reported for the first time in Wuhan (Hubei, China) in December 2019 (1, 2) and has become a major public health concern all over the world.….SARS-CoV-2, a novel coronavirus responsible for a December 2019 outbreak in Wuhan, China, causes a syndrome characterized by fever, cough, and dyspnea progressing to acute respiratory distress syndrome (1).….The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a global health concern that has spread worldwide since December 2019 (1-4).….Among the many facets of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic is the unprecedented pressure it has placed on different points of the supply chain for hospital systems worldwide such as collection devices for the diagnosis of COVID-19.….To control the growing COVID-19 pandemic, increased testing and containment is essential, yet clinical-grade sampling supplies are expensive and rapidly being depleted.These laboratories reported in February 2020 that commercial primer and probe batches for SARS-CoV-2 detection were contaminated with synthetic control material, causing delays of regional testing roll-out in various countries.We demonstrate the feasibility of using alternative consumer-grade swabs stored in 95% ethanol rather than viral transport media to detect SARS-CoV-2 from ten hospitalized persons and hospital rooms.The emergence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) created an exceptional situation in which numerous laboratories in Europe simultaneously implemented SARS-CoV-2 diagnostics.Transmission risk of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) in schools is unknown.
title_summ: Saliva as an Alternate Specimen Source for Detection of SARS-CoV-2 in Symptomatic Patients Using Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2.Feasibility of SARS-CoV-2 virus detection from consumer-grade cotton swabsNovel Coronavirus 2019 Transmission Risk in Educational SettingsThe Detection of SARS-CoV-2 using the Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2 and Roche cobas SARS-CoV-2 Assays.Multi-Center Evaluation of the Cepheid Xpert Xpress SARS-CoV-2 Assay for the Detection of SARS-CoV-2 in Oropharyngeal Swab Specimens.Evaluation of a rapid diagnostic assay for detection of SARS CoV-2 antigen in nasopharyngeal swab.Delayed Laboratory Response to COVID-19 Caused by Molecular Diagnostic Contamination.
